text: [Music]
I'm Tim Brown I'm with him aside I'm the
director of cloud and infrastructure we
are the mobile satellite companies we
have about 2,000 employees around the
globe but we have 45 different offices
five different data centers we operate
on every continent and we service
markets truly around the globe we
started out 40 years ago as a maritime
safety service providing you know
guaranteed service 24/7 of the maritime
at the government's on land and at sea
we've evolved over the years we now
provide high-speed broadband out to
everything from planes to cruise ships
to on land on sea to government's one of
the decisions we made early on is that
we wanted to work with an organization
that could support us through the
journey AWS is innovating so quickly and
to be able to adopt manage and maintain
a lot of the innovation you have to
become an expert from our strategy we
started out with what we call the
proof-of-concept release one project so
we really wanted to start out get a
stake in the ground understand get some
lessons learned and our first primary
goal of release one which we completed
in February of 2019 was to move 10% of
our what close as we started to build
out our business case for release two we
decide on the number to be in release
two is going to be another 55% so some
total of 65 percent of our workloads
which we're going to try to finish again
by the end of February 2020 and we're
currently on target to actually exceed
that so by going through the rapid
acceleration program we worked through a
huge workshop and through that workshop
we brought in some partners like
Junction and CenturyLink and as we walk
through those programs it was a forced
time period where we had all the
stakeholders in the room we rapidly gone
on the same page and they asked us 74
questions and it was kind of like
therapy they were brutally honest
questions about where we were from a
security point of view where we were
from a human point of view of skills
point of view a center of excellence
point of view and at the end of that
they gave us really honest answers it
wasn't anything that shocked or that
told us something we didn't know but
what it was was a great document in a
great way that we all communicated
together agreed to that and agreed to a
way forward so I think that helped us
greatly Amazon really understands the
longer-term goals here in the commitment
the relationship is just as critical as
the kind of the short-term we're good
with the fact that Amazon Web Services
follows a model that supports innovation
so a lot of times new tool sets will
come out they may not have all the
features you want but they continually
move the bar forward so it's important
to us that we see constant innovation
and a lot of times the challenges that
we're facing today are getting solved at
a rapid pace
[Music]
